attendees.name: Alper Tunga Burak
attendees.title: Founder & CEO
attendees.bio: Alper Tunga Burak is the Founder and CEO of Odine, a leading Telco Cloud-Native OSS/BSS Systems Integrator. He has extensive experience in the telecommunications sector, driving the company's vision to provide virtualized and cloud-native solutions. Under his leadership, Odine partners with global Tier-1 operators to accelerate their digital transformation and network modernization.
attendees.companyDescription: Odine is a global telecommunications technology company specializing in cloud-native, virtualized OSS/BSS and orchestration solutions for Tier-1 telecom operators worldwide. They enable operators to modernize their infrastructure, streamline wholesale voice and data operations, and accelerate their digital transformation journey.

attendees.name: Chuck Robbins
attendees.title: CEO
attendees.bio:
For over 25 years at Cisco, Robbins has demonstrated a keen understanding of the rapidly evolving business landscape and the critical role of technology in addressing both customer and global challenges. 

Robbins has championed initiatives across the company to enhance employee experience and culture, contributing to Cisco earning the top spot on World’s Best Workplaces, Fortune’s 100 Best Companies to Work For, People’s Companies that Care, and various other lists throughout his tenure.

Prior to becoming CEO, Robbins led Cisco’s global sales organization. He also held various leadership roles in regional sales, as well as Cisco’s partner organization, where he was instrumental in building one of the industry’s most robust partner programs.

attendees.name: Kevork Kechichian
attendees.title: Executive Vice President & General Manager, Data Center Group
attendees.bio:
Kevork Kechichian is executive vice president and general manager of the Data Center Group (DCG) at Intel Corporation. He is responsible for Intel’s data center business, including profit and loss, roadmap, and product planning, positioning and execution.  

 Kevork is a proven leader with 30 years of semiconductor experience. Prior to joining Intel in 2025, he served as EVP of Solutions Engineering at Arm, where he led technology development with partner ecosystems and managed the company's transformation from IP to solutions-based approaches. He previously served as EVP of MCU/MPU Engineering at NXP Semiconductors, where he led the company’s global architecture and system-on-chip (SoC) design. He also served as SVP of Engineering at Qualcomm, where he managed the Snapdragon SoC and Technology teams and was responsible for delivering more than 100 SoCs. 

Kevork holds a master’s in electrical engineering from Concordia University in Montreal, and a bachelor’s in electrical engineering from American University of Beirut.

attendees.name: Gregory Ernst
attendees.title: Corporate Vice President & Chief Revenue Officer, General Manager of Sales and Marketing Group
attendees.bio:
Gregory (Greg) Ernst is corporate vice president, chief revenue officer and general manager of the Sales and Marketing Group at Intel Corporation. In his role, Ernst oversees Intel’s global sales, marketing, customer support and customer success teams. He leads the company’s efforts to deepen customer relationships, drive customer and partner success, and foster sales and marketing approaches that broaden Intel’s business opportunities.

Ernst joined Intel in 1999. Throughout his career at Intel, he has held leadership roles across Intel’s Cisco, Dell, Hewlett-Packard Enterprise and HP Inc. sales account teams. He has also served as vice president in the Sales and Marketing Group and as general manager of United States sales.

Prior to his role as chief revenue officer, Ernst served as corporate vice president and general manager of the Americas region for Intel. In this role, he led the team of sellers and marketers that support all Americas-based customers and partners.

Ernst holds a bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering from the University of Texas at Austin.

meetings.title: Gigs x Rakuten
meetings.purpose: Rakuten Mobile executive team asked to meet with Gigs in December after introduction from Rakuten Capital. The initial context of the December 22nd meeting was to primarily scope working with Rakuten Mobile as a carrier - for international roaming or in the future for a larger relationship in Japan. This was an intorductory meeting between both parties. As a follow-up Sharad and Hermann wanted to use the opportunity at MWC to meet in-person to foster executive strategic alignment in the future.
meetings.otherDetails:
■Purpose/Objective: Executive Meeting with Gigs CEO as a follow-up from meeting on December 22nd 

■Requestor: Nandi Radmer (Gigs)

■Attendees(with title): Hermann (Gigs CEO and Co-Founder), Nandi (Lead Strategic Projects), Lo (Chief of Staff to Hermann)

■Location(Booth): Rakuten booth

■Duration: 30mins

■Date: March 3rd or 4th mid-morning or early afternoon

■Background (If possible): Rakuten Mobile executive team asked to meet with Gigs in December after introduction from Rakuten Capital. The initial context of the December 22nd meeting was to primarily scope working with Rakuten Mobile as a carrier - for international roaming or in the future for a larger relationship in Japan. This was an intorductory meeting between both parties. As a follow-up Sharad and Hermann wanted to use the opportunity at MWC to meet in-person to foster executive strategic alignment in the future.

meetings.title: Intel x Rakuten Symphony
meetings.purpose:
This would be the first meeting opportunity for both executives with Mickey-san and Sharad.
While I understand they have already met with our CEO Lip Bu Tan, we believe MWC'26 presents an excellent opportunity to further strengthen our executive relationships
meetings.otherDetails:
Executive Capabilities:
Kevork leads our Intel® Xeon® 6 Processors business unit and would provide valuable insights on product feedback and future collaboration opportunities
Greg heads our Sales organization and could discuss the strategic sales support needed
Additionally, Cristina Rodriguez, our former GM of the Network and Edge Group(now all under Kevork), is also planned to attend and could join these discussions.

meetings.title: Zain Kuwait - Rakuten Symphony
meetings.purpose: Open RAN deployment roadmap progression following initial engagement, defining Phase 2 rollout plans with Symphony orchestration for multi-vendor integration and network modernization across Kuwait operations. Network efficiency optimization and OpEx reduction strategy through AI-driven autonomous operations, plus cloud infrastructure and ecosystem partnerships to enhance digital services portfolio and drive new revenue opportunities.

meetings.title: STC - Rakuten Symphony
meetings.purpose: Vision 2030 alignment through Open RAN and autonomous network transformation, positioning STC as regional technology leader with Symphony-powered AI-driven operations and network intelligence. Strategic cloud infrastructure partnership for enterprise and consumer digital services expansion, with ecosystem collaboration opportunities in smart cities, IoT, and emerging technology ventures across Saudi Arabia and beyond.

meetings.title: Tawal - Rakuten Symphony
meetings.purpose: Open RAN in-building active infrastructure sharing model for Saudi Arabia's three MNOs (STC, Mobily, Zain), leveraging Symphony platform for multi-tenant orchestration and neutral host deployment economics. Business case development for Open RAN-based active sharing across commercial buildings, malls, and venues with focus on capex reduction, network slicing capabilities, and new revenue streams from shared infrastructure.

meetings.title: Aritel Africa- Rakuten Symphony
meetings.purpose: Open RAN economics and deployment roadmap for Africa operations, leveraging Rakuten's learnings to reduce capex/opex while improving network performance through Symphony automation. Autonomous network capabilities for operational efficiency at scale, plus cloud infrastructure partnerships to strengthen Airtel Payments Bank, digital services, and enterprise solutions ecosystem.
